alert.note: Alert for Maverick (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 3:24PM CDT until August 30 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Maverick. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 316 PM CDT, Heavy rainfall from earlier this morning has produced widespread 2 to 4 inches of rainfall across northwestern Maverick county, with a small area in north central Maverick county estimated between 4 and 9 inches. Runoff from earlier heavy rains combined with light rain through this afternoon will lead to arroyo and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Darling, State Highway 131 and Farm to Market Road 1908. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
